IssueName: Disconnect bot from voice after inactivity
IssueBody:
After 10minutes of nothing in queue we should disconnect the bot from voice
Every time something is queued, this timer should reset

IssueName: Create a React App to filter Hacktoberfest issues on the basis of languages and labels
IssueBody:
```
npm i hacktoberfest-issue-hunt
```

As `hacktoberfest-issue-hunt` is available as an NPM module, can we make a demo React App with an option to filter `hacktoberfest` issues based on languages like `js`, `python`, `go` and labels like `first timers only`, `beginner friendly`, `good first issues`.

- Refer [react-bootstrap](https://react-bootstrap.github.io)
- Check `hacktoberfest-issue-hunt` on [NPM](https://www.npmjs.com/package/hacktoberfest-issue-hunt)

You can [Create React App](https://github.com/facebook/create-react-app) to set up the React app by running one command.

```bash
npx create-react-app hacktoberfest-issue-hunt
cd hacktoberfest-issue-hunt
npm start
```
Labels: help wanted, good first issue, hacktoberfest, hacktoberfest2021, UI/UX, beginner friendly, first timers only

IssueName: Dart code for TCG Card Scanner
[Rails][React][Administrate] Add PDF document field to Story model
IssueBody:
We have heard from some of our potential end users (i.e. in Colombia) that it would be nice to be able to embed documents like PDFs to stories. For some storied places, there are existing documents that can be added to the story as additional context.

Let's add a `pdf_document` field to the `Story` model where users can add readable documents (in PDF format) to stories. This should be added through Rails ActiveStorage, similar to how we add attachments for videos and images.

_User stories:_
As an admin, I can add a PDF file to a story when I first upload it, so that I can provide more rich context to the story.
As an admin, I can add a PDF file to a story from the edit screen, so that I can provide more rich context to the story.

_Acceptance criteria:_ 
- Users with admin access see a field called "Documents" in the story editing screen
- Users with admin access see a field called "Documents" in the story upload flow
- Users can upload one or more documents
- Users see a success message once the document is successfully uploaded
- Users see an error message if the document does not upload
- Documents are stored in ActiveStorage
Labels: react, rails, epic: improve media embedding, Hacktoberfest

IssueName: [Rails][React][Administrate] Add audio file field to Place model
IssueBody:
One request that we've heard from potential users in Colombia is that it would be nice for an audio file pronouncing the Place name to play when the user opens a Place marker. This is because some indigenous communities are working on revitalizing language usage, and some young community members don’t actually know how places are pronounced. So this is a nice educational feature to add to Terrastories.

Let's add an audio field to the `Place` model called `name_audio` to allow users to upload audio files for Places. Let’s have it only accept MP3 or WAV files. This should be added through Rails ActiveStorage, similar to how we add attachments for images.

_User story:_
As an admin user, I want to upload an audio file to the Place model, so that I can share how to properly pronounce the place name and contribute to revitalizing indigenous languages

_Acceptance criteria:_ 
- Users with admin access see a field called "Audio" in the Place model when they are first creating a story
- Users with admin access see a field called "Audio" in the Place model when they edit the story
- Users see a message that tells them what format they can upload: “MP3 or WAV files only”
- Users can upload only one file
- Users can only upload a MP3 or WAV file
- Users see a success message once the document is successfully uploaded: “Upload successful”
- Users see an error message if the document does not upload: “Error: file did not upload correctly”
- Files are stored in Rails ActiveStorage
Labels: react, rails, epic: improve media embedding, Hacktoberfest

IssueName: [React] Create an introductory panel before displaying the StoryList in Map view
IssueBody:
Currently, when a user enters the Map, the StoryList in the sidebar is displayed immediately. There is a card on the right side of the screen that pops up and explains a bit about the terrastories app.

Let’s update the UI so that there is no more card and instead, we display an introductory panel in the sidebar before we display the list of Stories.

See below for the design.
![Screen Shot 2020-09-03 at 5 46 06 PM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8590508/92176889-641f9b80-ee0d-11ea-8bfb-afc72bda2b61.png)

note: copy change from this design -- Let's end the explore text at "all over" and not make it specific to the Matawai

We’ll likely need to create a new component which will be rendered into the Sidebar. Then the Sidebar will conditionally display this panel or the list. The condition can be based on some component state which determines whether or not the “Explore” button on this screen has been clicked in this session.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

- [ ] When a user goes to view the Story Map, they should see the introductory panel before they see the Stories.
- [ ] The user should not see the introductory panel after clicking the “Explore” button and should only see Stories.
- [ ] If the user refreshes the page, the introductory panel will be back. 
- [ ] The card on the right of the screen is fully deleted.

**Bonus points:** Add Jest tests
Also write unit tests for the pools

IssueName: Convert val to str when needed while calling zwave_js.set_value
IssueBody:
## Proposed change
Our services `set_value` and `multicast_set_value` first attempt to convert input values to numbers before accepting them as strings, and if they can be coerced into a number, the service assumed that was the intention. From #57154 there are cases where a number can appear to be a number but should be sent to the driver as a string.

In this PR, we check the metadata of the Z-Wave value that we are setting the value of to see the data type and convert the input back to a string if needed.


## Type of change

  What type of change does your PR introduce to Home Assistant?

  split it into multiple PRs. This makes things easier and faster to code review.
-->

- [ ] Code quality improvements to existing code or addition of tests

-->

Sometimes when claiming we get a 500.

**To Reproduce**
Claim normally and randomly get a 5xx error.

Catch the 500, give it a few seconds and retry. Put a Max number of retries of probably 5 (?) to not be in an infinte loop if the website is down.

IssueName: [BREAKING BUG][Rails] Remove empty field choices from filters (currently crashing Terrastories); add "No Options" message if none are available
IssueBody:
**Describe the bug**
There are a few bugs and issues with the filters on the sidebar of the Terrastories map view.

1. If there are some empty values for the fields being filtered (Region, Topic, Type of Place, Speaker), the first choice in the second filter dropdown will be a blank option. Clicking this will crash Terrastories.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/31662219/136296710-0b6c56ae-e766-4665-bd25-0d2a30c74423.png)

2. If there are no values whatsoever set for the fields being filtered, the second filter dropdown will show one or several blank options; clicking these will crash Terrastories.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/31662219/132909026-7479cbb5-2c49-4801-adfa-40d9a6efe344.png)

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Go to Terrastories. 
2. Create (or log in to) a default community with some sample data.
3. For some of the data, make sure that one of the filtered fields (Region, Type of Place, Topic, Speaker) is empty.
3. On the map view, click on `Select Category` and chose the Filter for that field
4. See error (as per screenshot) and if you click on the empty field, it crashes the app.

**Expected behavior**

1. If there are some (but not all) empty values for the fields being filtered, there should be no empty choice option at the very beginning. Instead, the stories/places without those values will just not be accessed through that filter.
2. In the case of there not being any values set for one of the fields being filtered, instead of seeing a blank option, you would see a grayed out "No Options" message as you do when you click on the second dropdown without first having selected a category in the first dropdown.

IssueName: Use an object to wrap the parameters
IssueBody: The service has too many constructor parameters, we should probably create an object to contain these configurations.

IssueName: Handle and wrap exceptions instead of just throwing internal exceptions
IssueBody: The service is currently just re-throwing exceptions thrown by third-party libraries. We should probably catch these exceptions and throw our own exceptions.

IssueName: [Rails] Change the order of options in the primary filter to alphabetical
IssueBody:
Let's change the order of the options in the primary filter to be alphabetical. 

So with the current selections, it would be `Region`, `Topic`, `Type of Place`, `Speaker`. If there were to be one added in the future, it would automatically be placed alphabetically as well.

(Note that the `filterMap` and `handleFilter` arrays in `App.jsx` have to be adjusted as well).

[⚡ esl-utils]: Unit tests for the Rect class  in `esl-utils/dom/rect`
IssueBody:
As an ESL contributor, I expect esl-utils to be covered by Unit Tests.

It is required to cover the Rect module (`esl-utils/dom/rect.ts`) with Unit Tests.

Note: examples of writing tests for other modules can be found in the `esl-utils/dom/test/` folder.

**Related information:** [Jest Documentation](https://jestjs.io/docs/getting-started)

IssueName: Remove overly complex premature optimization around separating routes by Verb.
IssueBody:
While this should provide a tiny, tiny speed increase, its silly and not worth the overhead. Let's simply change this to a binding slice instead of a slice for each verb.

https://github.com/bradcypert/ghast/blob/5f506ce21027a45fc6c7f2faca7f92d10cb56d68/pkg/router/router.go#L25-L33

IssueName: Migrate SimpliSafe to new web-based authentication
IssueBody:
<!--
  You are amazing! Thanks for contributing to our project!
  Please, DO NOT DELETE ANY TEXT from this template! (unless instructed).
-->
## Breaking change
<!--
  If your PR contains a breaking change for existing users, it is important
  to tell them what breaks, how to make it work again and why we did this.
  This piece of text is published with the release notes, so it helps if you
  write it towards our users, not us.
  Note: Remove this section if this PR is NOT a breaking change.
-->
SimpliSafe requires a new web-based authentication method. When starting up, Home Assistant will automatically prompt you to re-authorize your instance.

## Proposed change
<!--
  Describe the big picture of your changes here to communicate to the
  maintainers why we should accept this pull request. If it fixes a bug
  or resolves a feature request, be sure to link to that issue in the
  additional information section.
-->
This summer, SimpliSafe's unpublished API began notifying us that the API endpoint used to received authentication tokens is set to be deprecated at the end of this year:

```
This authentication endpoint is deprecated and may no longer function after December 1, 2021.
```

To that end, this PR implements a new web-based authentication method (following the path laid out by the SimpliSafe web and mobile apps). It is OAuth, but with a twist; the overall process can be found here: https://simplisafe-python.readthedocs.io/en/latest/usage.html#authentication

Because I'm lumping several changes into one version of `simplisafe-python`, this PR also updates some code touched by that change, such as renaming some existing methods (e.g., `lock() -> async_lock()`).

Code, tests, and docs are complete, but I'm leaving this in draft status while I run everything in my house for a few weeks; once I'm convinced things look good, I'll open it up. Welcome to feedback in the meantime!

Changelog: https://github.com/bachya/simplisafe-python/releases/tag/12.0.0-alpha.0
Diff: https://github.com/bachya/simplisafe-python/compare/11.0.6...12.0.0-alpha.0

## Type of change
<!--
  What type of change does your PR introduce to Home Assistant?
  NOTE: Please, check only 1! box!
  If your PR requires multiple boxes to be checked, you'll most likely need to
  split it into multiple PRs. This makes things easier and faster to code review.
-->

- [ ] Dependency upgrade

IssueName: [Bug][Rails] Null image tag displaying on popup when story card is activated
IssueBody: **Describe the bug** The popups on the map are set up to show an image, if there is one set for that place (via the `photo_url` field); if the value is null then it will not (see this code in `Popup.jsx` [here](https://github.com/Terrastories/terrastories/blob/8c53163545f64733a535cf98ebd56e63155f6775/rails/app/javascript/components/Popup.jsx#L13)). This works when you press on a marker point on the map: ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/31662219/136293738-dae1aea1-5cde-47b0-91b6-3107f4be8bdb.png) However, when you press on a story card in the sidebar -- which causes the map to navigate to the related Place and open up the popup -- if there is no photo, it still inserts an empty `` tag. ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/31662219/136293804-653bc717-d2ce-4d14-afbb-0285f5233a21.png) **To Reproduce** Steps to reproduce the behavior: 1. Open the Terrastories map view 2. Press on a marker for a Place that does not have a photo 3. You will not see an `` tag 4. Now, press on a Story that is linked to that Place 5. You will see the empty `` tag in the Popup **Expected behavior** If there is no image in the Place `photo_url` field, it should not insert an `` tag in the popup when you press a story card, much like it doesn't when you press a marker and open a popup that way.

IssueName: Pause and Resume command has been added as a new feature, add the commands for the same in readme and deploy.md
IssueBody:
**Documentation**

**Problem Statement**
Pause command as a feature has been added, I would like the contributor to add the details of the same in documentation.

**Available Commands**
```
        _p : Plays the song with search keyword following the command 
        _pn : Moves the song to the top of the queue
        _pause : Pause the currently playing song
        _resume : Resume the currently playing song
        _q : Shows the music added in list/queue
        _s : Skips the currently playing music
        _r : removes song from queue at index given.
        _l : Commands the bot to leave the voice channel
        _help : shows all the commands of the bot.
```
https://github.com/junegunn/fzf

Allows amcrest cameras' privacy mode to be controlled by the
integration.

<!--
  You are amazing! Thanks for contributing to our project!
  Please, DO NOT DELETE ANY TEXT from this template! (unless instructed).
-->
## Proposed change
Introduces the ability to control the privacy mode feature of Amcrest Cameras. Many of these cameras have a mask or some other way to provide privacy for the user. The current integration did not allow control of this feature. 


## Type of change
<!--
  What type of change does your PR introduce to Home Assistant?
  NOTE: Please, check only 1! box!

- [ ] Code quality improvements to existing code or addition of tests

This feature is not in the Amcrest Dev SDK documentation, however has been tried by a couple of people and found to work; however it is, technically, an undocumented feature.

IssueName: Create Union and Intersection of two Graphs.cpp
Make sure we have no `ha-icon` in supervisor
IssueBody:
## Proposed change

Loading `ha-icon` with an other MDI version will wipe the database. If the supervisor and HA core are not using the same version of MDI, this will give conflicts. Supervisor should not use `ha-icon`.

Removed `ha-icon` from all elements that are used by the supervisor.

## Type of change

<!--

IssueName: [#4] Update InMemoryFeatureRepository::remove contract with a Feature instead of FeatureId
IssueBody:
Blocked by: https://github.com/pheature-flags/toggle-core/pull/31
Closes #4

Homer supports [custom services](https://github.com/bastienwirtz/homer/blob/main/docs/customservices.md), and provides a [template](https://github.com/bastienwirtz/homer/blob/main/docs/development.md#custom-services) to easily add new ones.

It could be great to add some more. Before starting to work on a custom service please open an issue to describe your idea and discuss about it.

Some ideas: 
- [UpDown](https://updown.io/): Show status
- [M/Monit](https://mmonit.com/): Show global status information
- ...

Homer supports [built-in themes](https://github.com/bastienwirtz/homer/blob/main/docs/development.md#themes), based on [bulma](https://bulma.io/documentation/). 

It could be great to add some more. Before starting to work on a theme, please open an issue to describe your idea, link your inspiration if any, and discuss about it.  Themes are supposed to be mobile friendly and light & fast to load.

Ok I've got the build working, and the publish and release jobs stubbed out, though untested.

Linking the latest run from my fork, since Github Actions won't initially run until this PR is merged:
https://github.com/dbirks/salesforce-oauth/actions/runs/1313764530

Hey, and it looks like the `setup-java` Action has a built-in way to set the username and password for deploying to Maven Central (`server-username` and `server-password`), so we won't need to set up the settings.xml ourselves:
https://github.com/actions/setup-java/blob/main/docs/advanced-usage.md#publishing-using-apache-maven

Closes PR #3
Closes #4

IssueBody: You need to convert the code from class Component to functional component in ReactJS.

IssueName: [toggle-core] Update `FeatureRepository::remove` contract with a `Feature` instead of `FeatureId`
IssueBody:
In this epic we need to update the `FeatureRepository::remove` method contract in order to accept a `Feature` entity instead of its `FeatureId`.

Doing so, we'll be able to release the events recorded in the entity to dispatch later on.

This epic will be closed when these issues are closed:

* https://github.com/pheature-flags/toggle-core/issues/30
* https://github.com/pheature-flags/inmemory-toggle/issues/4
* https://github.com/pheature-flags/dbal-toggle/issues/4
Labels: enhancement, good first issue, epic, Hacktoberfest

Setup husky at the highest level of the project instead of all the projects in `packages`. This should ensure that all commits have to correctly linted through the entire project.

_No response_

IssueName: [MM-34337] Migrate 'components/mfa' and associated tests to TypeScript
IssueBody:
<!-- Thank you for contributing a pull request! Here are a few tips to help you:

1. If this is your first contribution, make sure you've read the Contribution Checklist https://developers.mattermost.com/contribute/getting-started/contribution-checklist/
2. Read our blog post about "Submitting Great PRs" https://developers.mattermost.com/blog/2019-01-24-submitting-great-prs
3. Take a look at other repository specific documentation at https://developers.mattermost.com/contribute
-->

#### Summary
<!--
A description of what this pull request does.
-->
This migrates the `components/mfa/confirm` component in the webapp to TypeScript. The trickiest parts were: 
1. Defining the event argument type for the `submit` and  `onKeyPress` functions; 
2. Rewriting the 'should submit on enter' test in TypeScript. I've used the 'submit on enter' test for the `edit_channel_purpose_modal` component as a reference to solve this problem, simulating the enter event via wrapper.

#### Ticket Link
<!--
If this pull request addresses a Help Wanted ticket, please link the relevant GitHub issue, e.g.

  Fixes https://github.com/mattermost/mattermost-server/issues/XXXXX

Otherwise, link the JIRA ticket.
-->
Fixes https://github.com/mattermost/mattermost-server/issues/17266
JIRA: https://mattermost.atlassian.net/browse/MM-34337

<!--
#### Related Pull Requests
List all PRs related to resolving a ticket. For instance, if you submitted a PR to `mattermost/mattermost-server`, please include it here.
- Has server changes (please link here)
- Has mobile changes (please link here)
-->

<!--
#### Screenshots
If the PR includes UI changes, include screenshots/GIFs.

For an easier comparison of UI changes a table (template below) can be used.

|  before  |  after  |
|----|----|
| <insert before screenshot here> | <insert after screenshot here> |

-->

#### Release Note
<!--
Add a release note for each of the following conditions:

* Config changes (additions, deletions, updates)
* API additions—new endpoint, new response fields, or newly accepted request parameters
* Database changes (any)
* Websocket additions or changes
* Anything noteworthy to a Mattermost instance administrator (err on the side of over-communicating)
* New features and improvements, including behavioural changes, UI changes and CLI changes
* Bug fixes and fixes of previous known issues
* Deprecation warnings, breaking changes, or compatibility notes

If no release notes are required write NONE. Use past-tense. Newlines are stripped.

Examples:

```
Added new API endpoints POST /api/v4/foo, GET api/v4/foo, and GET api/v4/foo/:foo_id.
```

```
Added a new config setting ServiceSettings.FooBar. Added a new column Foo to the Users table.
```

```
NONE
```
-->
```release-note
NONE
```
Labels: 2: Dev Review, Hacktoberfest, 3: QA Review, hacktoberfest-accepted, release-note-none, Contributor

IssueBody:
By default, In the Microsoft Active Directory, members of the authenticated user group can join up to 10 computer accounts in the domain. This value is defined in the attribute ms-DS-MachineAccountQuota on the domain-DNS object for a domain.

```powershell
Get-ADObject -Identity ((Get-ADDomain).distinguishedname) -Properties ms-DS-MachineAccountQuota

Set-ADDomain -Identity <DomainName> -Replace @{"ms-DS-MachineAccountQuota"="0"}
```

Users must have explicit permissions in Active Directory to join computers to a domain.
Labels: good first issue, potential test, hacktoberfest

IssueName: Text overflow not properly handled in preview cards
IssueBody: **Describe the bug** Check out the URL in this preview card forcing this overflow bug: **To Reproduce** Add a long word (like a URL) to a summary and then open it in a feed card like shown. **Expected behavior** Next to an article, this same content displays like this:

Can we add the summary to the report that it generates? The original script generates something like this:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/30907840/136282126-913504ec-f671-437a-9458-5f3576fc87a1.png)

This was linted with Yarn and tested with Jest. ### Yarn Lint ### Checklist - [x] I acknowledge that all my contributions will be made under the project's license - [x] I have made a material change to the repo (functionality, testing, spelling, grammar) - [x] I have read the [Contribution Guidelines](https://github.com/aaronshivers/snapit-hacktoberfest/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md) and my PR follows them - [x] I have titled the PR appropriately - [x] I have updated my branch with the main branch - [x] I have added tests that prove my fix is effective or that my feature works - [x] I have added the necessary documentation about the functionality in the appropriate .md file - [x] I have added inline documentation to the code I modified

IssueName: Typo when referring to existing CAs
IssueBody:
### Which section(s) is the issue in?

- https://docs.openshift.com/container-platform/4.8/installing/installing_aws/installing-restricted-networks-aws.html#installation-generate-aws-user-infra-install-config_installing-restricted-networks-aws
- https://docs.openshift.com/container-platform/4.8/installing/installing_ibm_z/installing-restricted-networks-ibm-z-kvm.html#installation-bare-metal-config-yaml_installing-restricted-networks-ibm-z-kvm

### What needs fixing?

There is a typo in the following phrase found in both aforementioned sections:

```
The value must be the contents of the certificate file that you used for your mirror
registry, which can be an exiting, trusted certificate authority or the self-signed certificate
that you generated for the mirror registry.
```
**Typo fix:**

`exiting` -> `existing`

Add code-block elements to format 5 code examples in user_guide/playbooks_handlers.rst
IssueBody:
### Summary

**Problem**:
Throughout the Ansible docs, there are instances where example code is preceded with a lead-in sentence ending in `::`.
Translation programs then attempt to translate this code, which we don't want.

**Solution:**
Enclose code  in a `.. code-block:: <lexer>` element, so that translation processes know to skip this content.
For a list of allowed values for _`<lexer>`_ , refer to [Syntax highlighting - Pygments](https://docs.ansible.com/ansible/latest/dev_guide/style_guide/index.html#syntax-highlighting-pygments).

**Scope:**
The `user_guide/playbooks_handlers.rst` file in the User Guide, contains **5 instances** of lead-in sentences ending with `::`. 
Navigate to the `docs/docsite/rst/user_guide/` directory  and use the following `grep` command to identify the line numbers:
```
$ grep -rn "^[[:blank:]]*[^[:blank:]\.\.].*::$" ./playbooks_handlers.rst
```

**Example:**

Before:
```
* If the file has a unique title, use that for the main page anchor::

   .. _unique_page::

```

After:
```
*  If the file has a unique title, use that for the main page anchor.

  .. code-block:: rst
   
    .. _unique_page::

```

This problem has been addressed in some other guides; view these merged PRs to help get you started:
- Network Guide: [#75850](https://github.com/ansible/ansible/pull/75850/files) 
- Developer Guide: [#75849](https://github.com/ansible/ansible/pull/75849/files) 

### Issue Type

Documentation Report

### Component Name

docs/docsite/rst/user_guide/playbooks_handlers.rst

### Ansible Version

```console
n/a
```


### Configuration

```console
n/a
```


### OS / Environment

n/a

### Additional Information

When example code is enclosed within a `code-block` element, translation programs do not attempt to translate the code.

### Code of Conduct

- [X] I agree to follow the Ansible Code of Conduct
Labels: easyfix, support:core, docs, hacktoberfest, docs_only, affects_2.13
